==Events==
* [[314]] &ndash; [[Silvester I]] begins his reign as [[Pope]] of the [[Catholic Church]], succeeding [[Pope Miltiades]].
*[[1504]] &ndash; France cedes [[Naples]] to [[Aragon]].
*[[1606]] &ndash; [[Gunpowder Plot]]: [[Guy Fawkes]] is executed for plotting against [[Parliament of England|Parliament]] and [[James I of England|King James]].
*[[1747]] &ndash; The first [[venereal disease]]s clinic opens at [[London Lock Hospital]].
*[[1801]] &ndash; [[John Marshall]] is appointed the [[Chief Justice of the United States]].
*[[1814]] &ndash; [[Gervasio Antonio de Posadas]] becomes [[Supreme Director of the United Provinces of the Río de la Plata|Supreme Director]] of [[Argentina]].
*[[1846]] &ndash; After the [[Milwaukee Bridge War]], Juneautown and Kilbourntown unify as the City of [[Milwaukee|Milwaukee, Wisconsin]].
*[[1848]] &ndash; [[John C. Frémont]] is [[Court-martial]]ed for mutiny and disobeying orders.
*[[1849]] &ndash; [[Corn Laws]] are abolished in the United Kingdom pursuant to legislation in 1846.
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[Alvan Graham Clark]] discovers the [[white dwarf]] star Sirius B, a companion of [[Sirius]], through an {{convert|18.5|in|cm|adj=on}} telescope now located at [[Northwestern University]].
*[[1865]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The [[United States Congress]] passes the [[Thirteenth Amendment to the Constitution of the United States]], abolishing slavery and submits it to the states for ratification.
*  1865   &ndash; American Civil War: [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] General [[Robert E. Lee]] becomes general-in-chief.
*[[1867]] &ndash; [[Maronite]] nationalist leader [[Youssef Karam]] leaves [[Lebanon]] on board a French ship bound for [[Algeria]].
*[[1891]] &ndash; [[History of Portugal (1834–1910)|History of Portugal]]: The first attempt at a Portuguese [[republicanism|republican]] [[revolution]] breaks out in the northern city of [[Porto]].
*[[1900]] &ndash; Datu Muhammad Salleh is [[assassination|assassinated]] in Kampung Teboh, Tambunan, ending the [[Mat Salleh Rebellion]].
*[[1915]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[German Empire|Germany]] is the first to make large-scale use of [[Chemical weapons in World War I|poison gas]] in warfare in the [[Battle of Bolimów]] against [[Russian Empire|Russia]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; World War I: Germany announces that its [[U-boat]]s will [[U-boat Campaign (World War I)|resume unrestricted submarine warfare]] after a two-year hiatus.
*[[1918]] &ndash; A [[Battle of May Island|series of accidental collisions]] on a misty Scottish night leads to the loss of two [[Royal Navy]] [[submarine]]s with over a hundred lives, and damage to another five British warships.
*[[1919]] &ndash; The [[Battle of George Square]] takes place in [[Glasgow]], Scotland.
*[[1929]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union]] exiles [[Leon Trotsky]].
*[[1930]] &ndash; [[3M]] begins marketing [[Scotch Tape]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: Allied forces are defeated by the Japanese at the [[Battle of Malaya]] and retreat to the island of Singapore.
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: German Field Marshal [[Friedrich Paulus]] surrenders to the Soviets at [[Battle of Stalingrad|Stalingrad]], followed 2 days later by the remainder of his Sixth Army, ending one of the war's fiercest battles.
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: American forces land on [[Kwajalein Atoll]] and other islands in the Japanese-held [[Marshall Islands]].
*  1944   &ndash; World War II: During the [[Operation Shingle|Anzio]] campaign the [[1st Ranger Battalion]] (Darby's Rangers) is destroyed behind enemy lines in a heavily outnumbered encounter at [[Battle of Cisterna]], Italy.
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[United States Army|US Army]] private [[Eddie Slovik]] is [[capital punishment|executed]] for [[desertion]], the first such execution of an American soldier since the [[American Civil War|Civil War]].
*  1945   &ndash; World War II: About 3,000 inmates from the [[Stutthof concentration camp]] are forcibly marched into the [[Baltic Sea]] at Palmnicken (now [[Yantarny]], Russia) and executed.
*[[1946]] &ndash; [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|Yugoslavia]]'s new [[1946 Yugoslav Constitution|constitution]], modeling that of the [[Soviet Union]], establishes six constituent republics ([[Bosnia and Herzegovina]], [[Croatia]], [[Republic of Macedonia|Macedonia]], [[Montenegro]], [[Serbia]] and [[Slovenia]]).
*[[1949]] &ndash; [[These Are My Children]], the first television daytime [[soap opera]] is broadcast by the NBC station in Chicago.
*[[1950]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|President]] [[Harry S. Truman]] announces a program to develop the [[hydrogen bomb]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; A [[North Sea flood of 1953|North Sea flood]] causes over 1,800 deaths in the Netherlands and over 300 in the United Kingdom
*[[1957]] &ndash; Eight people on the ground in [[Pacoima, California]] are killed following the [[Pacoima aircraft accident|mid-air collision]] between a [[Douglas DC-7]] airliner and a [[Northrop F-89 Scorpion]] fighter jet.
*[[1958]] &ndash; [[Explorer program]]: ''[[Explorer 1]]'' &ndash; The first successful launch of an American [[satellite]] into orbit.
*  1958   &ndash; [[James Van Allen]] discovers the [[Van Allen radiation belt]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[Project Mercury]]: [[Mercury-Redstone 2]] &ndash; [[Ham the Chimp]] travels into [[space science|outer space]].
*[[1966]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union]] launches the unmanned [[Luna 9]] spacecraft as part of the [[Luna programme|Luna program]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Viet Cong]] attack the United States embassy in [[Saigon]], and other attacks, in the early morning hours, later grouped together as the [[Tet Offensive]].
*  1968   &ndash; [[Nauru]] gains independence from Australia.
*[[1971]] &ndash; [[Apollo program]]: [[Apollo 14]] &ndash; Astronauts [[Alan Shepard]], [[Stuart Roosa]], and [[Edgar Mitchell]], aboard a [[Saturn V]], lift off for a mission to the [[Fra Mauro formation|Fra Mauro Highlands]] on the [[Moon]].
*  1971   &ndash; The [[Winter Soldier Investigation]], organized by the [[Vietnam Veterans Against the War]] to publicize [[war crime]]s and atrocities by [[United States|Americans]] and allies in [[Vietnam]], begins in [[Detroit]], [[Michigan]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; The first [[McDonald's]] in the [[Soviet Union]] opens in Moscow.
*[[1995]] &ndash; President [[Bill Clinton]] authorizes a $20 billion loan to Mexico to stabilize its [[Economy of Mexico|economy]].
*[[1996]] &ndash; An explosives-filled truck rams into the gates of the [[Central Bank of Sri Lanka]] in [[Colombo]], [[Sri Lanka]] killing at least 86 and injuring 1,400.
*  1996   &ndash; [[Comet Hyakutake]] is discovered by Japanese amateur astronomer [[Yuji Hyakutake]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Alaska Airlines Flight 261]] crash: An [[MD-83]], experiencing horizontal stabilizer problems, crashes in the Pacific Ocean off the coast of [[Point Mugu, California]], killing all 88 aboard.
*[[2001]] &ndash; In the Netherlands, a Scottish court convicts [[Libya]]n [[Abdelbaset al-Megrahi]] and acquits another Libyan citizen for their part in the bombing of [[Pan Am Flight 103]] over [[Lockerbie]], Scotland in 1988.
*[[2003]] &ndash; The [[Waterfall rail accident]] occurs near [[Waterfall, New South Wales]], Australia.
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[31 January 2007 Birmingham raid|Suspects are arrested]] in [[Birmingham]] in the UK, accused of plotting the kidnap, holding and eventual beheading of a serving Muslim British soldier in [[Iraq]].
*[[2009]] &ndash; In [[Kenya]], at least 113 people are killed and over 200 injured following an [[Molo fire|oil spillage ignition]] in [[Molo, Kenya|Molo]], days after [[2009 Nakumatt supermarket fire|a massive fire]] at a [[Nakumatt]] supermarket in [[Nairobi]] killed at least 25 people.
*[[2010]] &ndash; ''[[Avatar (2009 film)|Avatar]]'' becomes the first film to gross over [[List of highest-grossing films|$2 billion worldwide]].
*[[2011]] &ndash; A [[January 31 – February 2, 2011 North American blizzard|winter storm]] hits North America for the [[January 25–27, 2011 North American blizzard|second time in the same month]], causing $1.8 billion in damage across the United States and Canada and killing 24 people.
*[[2013]] &ndash; [[Torre Ejecutiva Pemex explosion|An explosion]] at the [[Torre Ejecutiva Pemex|Pemex Executive Tower]] in Mexico City kills at least 33 people and injures more than 100.
